It belongs to the Poaceae family, commonly known as grasses, and is characterized by its delicate, slender stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences, which are adapted for wind pollination. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
